H0.text: Backbone is the characteristic feature that defines Vertebrata.

H1.text: Bones characterize Vertebrata, as they are present in these organisms.

H2.text: Muscles are what vertebrata are characterized by the presence of.

H3.text: Thumbs are the characteristic that Vertebrata are defined by.

A4.text: Vertebrates are distinguished from all other animals, including other chordates, by multiple synapomorphies: namely a vertebral column

A5.text: Vertebrates (and other chordates) belong to the Bilateria, a group of animals with mirror symmetrical bodies
